title: Bug 3970 - UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files
description: The Windows workstations are used as X terminals and to run Eclipse since PCs are cheaper than Unix boxes.
OB: When creating a new file, we currently use the line delimiter returned from System.getProperties("line.delimiter"), but this might not always be desired by the user.
EB: Even if the new file is created on Windows, it should have Unix line delimiters since the end product is a Unix product. There should be a UI in the Preferences section to define the line delimiter for new files. The possible values should include DOS/Windows, Mac, Unix, and the default platform line delimiter. The UI should be provided by the Workbench, ensuring that all plugins use the same line delimiter for new files.
SR:
1. Open Eclipse.
2. Go to the Preferences section.
3. Look for the option to define the default line delimiter for new files.
4. Choose the desired line delimiter from the available options.
5. Create a new file and verify that the chosen line delimiter is used.
